Definition: You will receive a short poem written by a kid. Based on the poem, you will need to predict if the kid is in elementary school or high school. Anyone who is from grade 1st to 6th-grade will be considered as in elementary school, and 7th to 12th-grade kids will be considered as in high school. There are only two possible outputs, i.e., elementary and high. All inputs have at least one output and it cannot have both categories at a time.

Positive Examples.input: he look into your eye that same look just take your breathe away you feel at that moment that he be definitely the one for you but just when you realize that just as fast a he take your breathe away he take your heart and break it into tiny little piece and watch it burn
Positive Examples.explanation: The poem is long and linguistically well structured, and the prediction is correct.

Positive Examples.input: dry leaf be fly around slowly drift to the ground the grass be turn golden brown make the colour of autumn abound
Positive Examples.explanation: The poem is shorter, and is using very basic words.

Positive Examples.input: easter egg lay in the grass at the park easter sunday for the egg hunt
Positive Examples.explanation: The poem is very short and used very simple words.

Negative Examples.input: one day i buy a dog and his name be buddy he dig alot and get very muddy he be so sweet that he should be beat he can never sit still in a seat
Negative Examples.explanation: While the poem is not very long, it is very well structured, without a lot of grammatical errors. The author is actually in high school grade 9.

Negative Examples.input: hello knock first you never knock on my door first so now you half to pay me back o. k
Negative Examples.explanation: The poem is too short, contains a lot of grammatical errors, and doesn't make sense. The author is in elementary school grade 2.

Negative Examples.input: fast shiny agile run through the yard pounce on a rubber ball carry it prey smooth quick sleek swimming around the pool try to be fast than my brother ray furry soft warm laying on the couch my dog grayson
Negative Examples.explanation: While the poem is very long, it is poorly structured and doesn't make a lot of sense.
